dataset.remarks: The Dark Energy Survey (DES) is a five-year program (2012B-0001, PI Josh Frieman) using the Dark Energy Camera (DECam) on the CTIO Blanco 4m telescope to image 5,000 square degrees of sky in 5 bands (g, r, i, z and Y), and to carry out a time-domain survey of repeated visits over 30 square degrees. The primary goal of DES is to probe the origin of accelerating cosmic expansion through measurements of galaxy clusters, weak lensing, galaxy clustering, and type Ia supernovae. However, the data are valuable for many other astronomical applications. The DES-Y1 data release consists of science observations taken between September 2013 and early February 2014, covering roughly 1800 square degrees of the survey footprint in the South Galactic Cap. This includes more than 160 sq. degrees overlapping the Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS) Stripe 82 region, and about 20 visits to ten of the DES supernova fields. This release includes 13,890 DECam exposures that have been reduced and calibrated through the DES Data Management (DESDM) pipeline at the National Center for Supercomputing Applications (NCSA).

column.name: [cx]
column.summary: Cartesian X (J2000)

column.name: [cy]
column.summary: Cartesian Y (J2000)

column.name: [cz]
column.summary: Cartesian Z (J2000)

column.name: [htmid]
column.summary: HTM ID (J2000)

column.name: [zoneid]
column.summary: Zone ID

column.name: [seqID]
column.summary: sequential ID

column.name: [dtpropid]
column.summary: NOAO proposal identification, or generic program identifier for data without assigned proposal ID.

column.name: [surveyid]
column.summary: The survey ID. AS not all NOAO data re from surveys, this may be a blank value.

column.name: [release_date]
column.summary: Date for public release of the data.

column.name: [start_date]
column.summary: Calendar data (not UT) at start of observing night.

column.name: [date_obs]
column.summary: UT date and time, from DATE-OBS header keyword. Not available for all instruments.

column.name: [dtpi]
column.summary: Principal investigator

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right ascension

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination

column.name: [telescope]
column.summary: Telescope

column.name: [instrument]
column.summary: Instrument

column.name: [filter]
column.summary: Filter used for observation. Not available for all instruments.

column.name: [exposure]
column.summary: Exposure time. Not available for all instruments.

column.name: [obstype]
column.summary: Type of observation, from OBSTYPE header keyword. Not available for all instruments.

column.name: [obsmode]
column.summary: A newer FITS keyword indicating the type of observation mode. Older files may sometimes lack any value for this.

column.name: [proctype]
column.summary: Data processing type: Raw (raw data), INstCal(pipeline-calibrated single exposure), Resampled (calibrated image onto sky plane), Skysub (skysubstracted NEWFIRM image), Stack (coadded sum of a sequence of exposures), or MasterCal calibration file).

column.name: [prodtype]
column.summary: Data product type: Image, Dqmask (data quality mask), Expmap (Exposure map for stacked images), png (preview image).

column.name: [seeing]
column.summary: Average seeing FWHM in arcsec. AVailable for pipeline-processed imaging data only.

column.name: [depth]
column.summary: Approximate 5-sigma photometric depth for piont sources. Available for pipeline-processed imaging data only.

column.name: [dtacqnam]
column.summary: Original data file name supplied at the telescope by the observer or data-taking system.

column.name: [archive_file]
column.summary: Filename assigned to a data file in the NOAO Science Archive. All files are renamed to unique names when they enter the

column.name: [filesize]
column.summary: File size in bytes

column.name: [reference]
column.summary: reference to fits file.

column.name: [md5sum]
column.summary: md5sum is used to verify that a file has not changed as a result of a faulty file transfer, a disk error or non-malicious
